page.title: 02Ecology Roundway Covert.
page.content: {Roundway Hill Covert { }The covert consists of 68 acres of steep west facing scarp. It was originally scrub and grassland but was planted by Lord Roundway as a beechwood. The wood grew to maturity and was felled in 1949. It was replanted, but the operation failed due to the dry exposed chalk In 1956 the land was leased to the Forestry Commision and the wood was re-established. Within the covert there is a nature trail constructed by Devizes School and the Wiltshire Wildlife Conservation Corp.
